page.title: 01Candesby Area
page.content: This is an entirely rural area, intensively cultivated with large fields and scattered farms. Candlesby Hill on the edge of the Wolds dominates the area. Two main roads A1028 and A158 carry heavy holiday coastal traffic in summer but otherwise mostly local services and agricultural vehicles. The Gunby Hall Estate (National Trust) and remnants of Scremby and Candlesby Hale estates retain a pleasantly wooded aspect to the A158 and surroundings.Residents of the area commute to nearby small towns to work. A few are self employed tradesmen and agricultural workers. Former primary schools at Welton and Candlesby are now Village Halls encouraging more community activity but residents often look to larger centres for their shopping and recreation.
